metadata.title: CVE-2015-6776 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The opj_dwt_decode_1* functions in dwt.c in OpenJPEG, as used in PDFium inGoogle Chrome before 47.0.2526.73, allow remote attackers to cause a denialof service (out-of-bounds array access) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via crafted JPEG 2000 data that is mishandled during a discretewavelet transform.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6776` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1106').
